meanings.definition: Defiance of authority or refusal to obey orders.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was frustrated by the student's constant insubordinations in class.
meanings.sent2: The insubordinations of the soldiers led to chaos in the ranks.
meanings.sent3: The insubordinations of the mischievous puppy made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her insubordinations were like a storm brewing on the horizon, unpredictable and disruptive.
meanings.sent5: The insubordinations of the toddler were as loud as thunder, echoing through the house.

meanings.definition: Acts of disobedience or rebellion against authority.
meanings.sent1: The insubordinations of the workers caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent2: The general was strict to prevent any insubordinations among the troops.
meanings.sent3: The insubordinations of the cat refusing to come inside were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The insubordinations of the waves crashing against the shore were a sight of defiance.
meanings.sent5: His insubordinations were like sparks igniting a rebellion, spreading through the group.
